summary: Debugging Duplicate Function Calls in Large Codebase
Nx Cloud Logs Printed Twice: Debugging Duplicate Calls

content.text: I'll help you open a PR. Let me first check the current git status and see what changes are ready to be committed.

input.description: Check git status for uncommitted changes

content.content:

nothing to commit, working tree clean

84796d011e docs(misc): add titles to intro/overview pages (#31636)

9225aed139 fix(core): prevent nx cloud logs from being shown twice
fa7d37e5ed feat(core): improve message when workspace is not detected (#31632)
84796d011e docs(misc): add titles to intro/overview pages (#31636)
06089663c6 feat(js): add copy-workspace-modules executor (#31545)
e1dfe6ea09 fix(angular): handle inferred projects without project configuration files in migrations (#31633)

input.description: Check diff between master and current branch

input.command:
gh pr create --title "fix(core): prevent nx cloud logs from being shown twice" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Current Behavior

When Nx Cloud forcibly exits while the TUI is running, the process exit handler gets triggered multiple times, causing logs to be shown twice and terminal restoration issues.

## Expected Behavior

The process exit handler should only be triggered once, ensuring clean terminal restoration and preventing duplicate log messages.

## Related Issue(s)

This PR fixes an issue where Nx Cloud logs were being duplicated due to multiple process exit handlers being registered.

EOF
)"

message.content: No, this isn't a good description. What is happening now is that there are 2 logs for the nx cloud link when nx is invoked from a global install. The global install invokes the local version of Nx but both invoke the flushing of captured logs. Now it is invoked from the local version of Nx but users will have to update their global version to resolve this issue.

content.text:
I understand now. The issue is that when Nx is invoked from a global install, it triggers the local version, but both the global and local versions are trying to flush captured logs, causing duplicate Nx Cloud log output. Your fix moves the process exit handler from the global entry point to the local one, so only the local version handles log flushing.

Let me create a PR with the correct description:

input.command:
gh pr create --title "fix(core): prevent duplicate nx cloud logs from global and local nx invocations" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Current Behavior

When Nx is invoked from a global install, both the global and local versions register process exit handlers that flush captured logs. This causes Nx Cloud logs to be displayed twice - once from the global installation and once from the local installation.

## Expected Behavior

Only the local Nx installation should handle log flushing, preventing duplicate log output. The process exit handler is moved from the global entry point (nx.ts) to the local entry point (init-local.ts) so that log flushing only occurs once.

## Related Issue(s)

This change requires users to update their globally installed Nx to fully resolve the duplicate logging issue, as the fix is now in the local version that gets invoked.

EOF
)"
input.description: Create PR with accurate description of the duplicate logging fix

content.text:
PR created: https://github.com/nrwl/nx/pull/31641

The PR explains that the duplicate logs occur because both global and local Nx installations were registering exit handlers, and your fix ensures only the local version handles log flushing.
